holidays.name: Put A Pillow On Your Fridge Day
holidays.description: A quirky day encouraging people to place a pillow on their fridge for good luck and good dreams, believed to bring peace to your household.
holidays.origin: This odd tradition likely stems from old superstitions mixing domestic comfort with dream symbolism.
holidays.funFact: Some people actually leave pillows on their fridges for weeks, claiming it helps them sleep better!

holidays.name: Learn About Composting Day
holidays.description: Dedicated to educating people about the benefits and methods of composting to reduce waste and create rich soil.
holidays.origin: Started by environmental groups aiming to promote sustainable waste management and gardening.
holidays.funFact: Composting can reduce household waste by up to 30% and reduce methane emissions from landfills.

holidays.name: Resistor Day
holidays.description: Celebrated by electronics enthusiasts to honor the humble resistor, a crucial component in circuits that controls electric current.
holidays.origin: Unofficial holiday among engineering and maker communities appreciating electronic components.
holidays.funFact: The color bands on resistors represent numerical values and can be read like a secret code!

holidays.name: Birthday of John F. Kennedy, Jr.
holidays.description: Fans celebrate the birthday of JFK Jr., American lawyer, journalist, and magazine publisher, symbolic for his charisma and legacy.
holidays.origin: Honored more informally by history buffs and those nostalgic for American politics of the 90s.
holidays.funFact: JFK Jr.'s life inspired a generation fascinated with politics, style, and tragic destiny.
